DOC.brief_summary: The objective of the present study is to determine the relation between vascular injury induced by the stent and strut thickness.
DOC.brief_title: Vessel Injury in Relation With Strut Thickness Assessed by OCT
DOC.detailed_description: Thinner struts produce less arterial injury after stent implantation.The objective of the present study is to determine the relation between vascular injury induced by the stent and strut thickness. Vessel injury after stent implantation will be evaluated with optical coherence tomography (OCT). Two stents platforms with different strut thickness (Coroflex ISAR 50 microns and Biomatrix 120 microns) will be compared.
DOC.criteria: Patients older than 18 years Ischemic symptoms or evidence of myocardial ischemia (inducible or spontaneous) in the presence of >50% de novo stenosis located in native coronary vessels Target lesion located in the left main stem STEMI Restenosis Cardiogenic shock Malignancies or other comorbid conditions with life expectancy less than 12 months or that may result in protocol noncompliance Known allergy to the study medications (probucol, sirolimus, zotarolimus) Pregnancy (present, suspected, or planned)
